fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.data.time

Interface ITimeStructure

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IDateTimeData, ITimeData

    public interface ITimeStructure
    Provides read/write access to common time of day attributes.

    Note: when this time structure interface is applied to an object with a time zone, the UTC time zone is used when getting and setting specific time-of-day fields.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Gets the hour-of-day attribute value.

    • Method Detail

      • getHour

        int getHour()
        Gets the hour-of-day attribute value.
        Returns:
        the hour of day, in the range [0..23]. When this time structure is applied to a date, the value of this field is relative to the UTC time zone.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        setHour(int)

      • setHour

        void setHour(int hour)
        Sets the hour-of-day attribute value.
        Parameters:
        hour - the hour of day, in the range [0..23]. When this time structure is applied to a date, the value of this field is relative to the UTC time zone.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the value is out of range.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getHour()

      • getMinute

        int getMinute()
        Gets the minute-of-hour attribute value.
        Returns:
        the minute-of-hour, in the range [0..59]. When this time structure is applied to a date, the value of this field is relative to the UTC time zone.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        setMinute(int)

      • setMinute

        void setMinute(int minute)
        Sets the minute-of-hour attribute value.
        Parameters:
        minute - the minute of the hour, in the range [0..59]. When this time structure is applied to a date, the value of this field is relative to the UTC time zone.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the value is out of range.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getMinute()

      • getSecond

        Gets the second-of-minute attribute value.
        Returns:

        Since:

      • getMilliSecond

        Gets the millisecond-of-second attribute value.
        Returns:
        the millisecond-of-second, in the range [0..999].
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
